messageBody:
I have a simple program using RMI. When I run the program from its'
main it works fine. When I try using a JUnit Test Harness (at the
client end) I get the following exception...
<QUOTE>

C:\Java\rmi2>java junit.swingui.TestRunner AllTests
java.security.AccessControlException: access denied
(java.io.FilePermission C:\j2sdk1.4.0\lib\ComputeServer_Stub.class
read)
at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown
Source)
at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown
Source)
at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkRead(Unknown Source)
at java.io.File.exists(Unknown Source)
at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.loadFileData
(TestCaseClassLoader.java:133)
at junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader.lookupClassData
(TestCaseClassLoader.java:119)
...
<UNQUOTE>

The ComputerServer_Stub.class is the output of rmic but I am at a
loss why it thinks it should be in j2sdk1.4.0\lib! In desperation I
copied it to that folder but it made no deifference.

Am I missing something fundamental or does this indicate that I
cannot use JUnit to test RMI programs.

The code is running (or not) on a W2000 platform - currently both the
RMI server and the RMI client are on the same machine.

Any help advice would be appreciated.

Regards
Steve.
